Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with nice view”
Reviews.Author: Marcin W
Reviews.Content: It's nice hotel with view on Bosfor and Betisktas Stadium. Very good service, they helped me in many things. Perfect place for bussines or private stay,.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent memories”
Reviews.Author: Ioannis B
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights for vacation and I really enjoyed it. The staff was very friendly. The upgraded room was very big and comfortable and the view from therestaurant on 7th floor was magic.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: zara h
Reviews.Content: great location. clean rooms in a reasonable size (I recommend the bosphore view ones). breakfast is good in beautiful restaurant in 7th floor with good view of istanbul. you can also enjoy its food for lunch or dinner because it is really worth the price. really expensive wi-fi internet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: C_360
Reviews.Content: It is in Macka, very central neighbourhood of Istanbul. The rooms are very big, but very comfortable. Staff is great. Breakfast is at the roof with a wonderful view.

Reviews.Title: “Truly A Gem”
Reviews.Author: alondongirl78
Reviews.Content: rooms very well equipped - great service - price correct. location top.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay with bosphorous view”
Reviews.Author: venture_travel
Reviews.Content: This is my secind stay at hilton parksa. I think that the location is really convenient, which is a few minutes by taxi to taksim .sqauare. Quiet with a lovely view, excellent staff who are very polite and professional. I recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Standart Hilton Quality”
Reviews.Author: Delta31tr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for 1 night - had a late check-in, very attentative and helpfull front desk - good breakfast at the top of the hotel - with good view

Reviews.Title: “Other than the location, this is a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Charming_Karl
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Istanbul, the taxi driver had the most difficult time finding this hotel! He seemed to get lost several times, even after stopping in another Hilton nearby and asking for directions. That started our visit off on the wrong foot, but our equilibrium was restored when we entered our room, a nice large room, and saw the plate of snacks and goodies and a complimentary bottle of red Turkish wine. And then, the view from our window was incredible - the Bosphorus in front of us, and the Ayasofia and Blue Mosque off in the distance. The only negative was that our room was supposed to be non-smoking, but it smelled like it had been smoked in very recently and not cleaned after that. When reviewing Hilton properties, I have to remind myself that my experiences there are exceptional, since my girlfriend is a Diamond member and we therefore get the best rooms and everything complimentary, etc. Nevertheless, it was great to get free Wi-fi, and the large breakfast in the Executive room every morning with English newspapers was nice, and we also ate the free dinner there a couple of nights as well. The hotel has a restaurant upstairs with a gorgeous view, but we decided to spend our food dollars on the meals we ate in the historic section when we were out sightseeing. When we go back to Istanbul, we will probably look for a hotel closer to the action, i.e., in the Sultanahmet district. The taxi rides from the Hilton ParkSA to all other parts of Istanbul and back really added up by the end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved hte infinity pool on the roof and the views”
Reviews.Author: LondonAsa_2
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was really nice, with fairly big room and nice view of the Bosphorous. I enjoyed the infinity pool in partcular. One downside though was a disco which takes place on the roof of the hotel which is quite loud and we could hear the music in our room. Now about the area, the hotel is based on the other side of the Bosphorous which means each time when you want to get to the main landmarks you have too take the boat ride which is cheap but somewghat lenghty. We did enjoy it but if I was to to choose again I would pick hotel on the other side of the Bosphorous. The area itself is quite nice for long walks along the water and is appearanlty meant to be place to live for middle class people. There are planety of bars, cafes and restaurants to choose from if you don't wnat to travel across the water every time you want ot eat out. You can also nip out to the nearby food market just 5 minutes away from the hotel. I also found the hotel quite pricey especially given the not best location.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4stars, but a very good 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: nickunknown
Reviews.Content: The rooms must be improved. Helpful front desk, no problem to talk in English

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 150Londonjp
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in town but quÄ±te small bedrooms, staff very frÄ±endly and helpful Lots of kÄ±ds stayÄ±ng so very noisy Ä±n teh evening

Reviews.Title: “very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: litsa p
Reviews.Content: We visited Instanbul and stayed in this hotel for two nights! It was very good, very clear and all the stuff was very kind.Some rooms hadn;t a good view! The view from the 7th floor was amazing!The breakfast excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: Halawis
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice upstairs bar that we enjoyed champions league games. Make sure to take a room with a view, the breakfast is a must and the restaurant at the first floor is very nice. The ferry station is 7 minutes walking, and it will take u to any where in minutes. For the price you pay, I would visit the hotel for business and even pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Big is not Better”
Reviews.Author: TOPCAT010
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to this Hotel having been unable this Christmas to obtain the type of room I wanted in THE ISTANBUL HILTON I was offered The Park Hilton and I have to say the staff and the Hotel in General could not have made my stay better - Spend the extra and go for an Executive Room , this gives you entry to the small Lounge where you can enjoy snacks , Drinks and B/Fast in comfort , and the front rooms have a lovely view over the Bosphorus . The Hotel is small but well run and the catering is of a very High standard - even the scrambled eggs come out right ! The rooms are clean and well equipped and the position of the Hotel is perfect to get about - Parking is over the road in a small but well run Car Park which the Hotel own and transport is never a problem - taxi , Bus or Metro .The Hotel is not the Large Hilton but remember big is not always best.I will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “My updated review”
Reviews.Author: vl1970
Reviews.Content: After 4 stays, I would like to add fe comments. First the good things: - staff in executive lounge and club7 restaurant VERY friendly, polite and helpful - excellent breakfast choice; also had good meals in club7 (see note below) - rooms are clean and smell nice Not so nice: - no dumpers on room doors means you hear (ie. will wake you up) neighbors up to 5 rooms away shutting the doors. Room-to-room walls made of "wood" which emphasizes the effect. - also no noise insulation on room doors => hear all talking from the corridor.. (sort of soft rubber tape between the door and frame is cheap and efficient solution for both problems above!) - room temperature 27C - can not be lowered â€“ receptionist said this is normal - not sure what she meant, but for me normal bedroom temperature ~22C

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, in need of refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyboyFinland
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in December for business. Hilton is a bit outdated, but the location compensates a lot. Just around the corner is Taksim square, the heart of the modern Istanbul. Drinks in the lobby bar are pricey, avoid them. Buffet dinner excellent.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: 133Kay
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and incredibly helpful. Location walking distance to the boats, Dolmabahce Palace and boat cruises, a lovely park and the tram to take you to all the historic locations. Cabs at the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Beebo73
Reviews.Content: Its the worst hotel you can ever go to. Its never for it again or any hilton hotel. We had an online confirmation before we go with a specific rate, when we reached there, the front office denied the rate and tried to sell us higher floors with executive benefits, we agreed however it was more expensive for no reason. My sister was on a business trip and I decided to accompany her as I have never been to istanbul. When the rest of her team arrived, each one was charged a different price and after alot of negotiations they decided to reduce the price.In breif, they will try to upsell the facility in a very cheap way and get advantage of the customer, but still this is the worst thing, my sister had a business dinner in the cloud 7 resturant in the hotel and she had food posinous, I had to take her to the hospital at 4:00 am , where they had blood analysis and some first aid. To my great surprise, when we confronted the hotel management they insisted that this was due to excess alcohol, while she doesnt drink in the first place. we escalated to the hilton management and the hilton worldwide in vain, they still insist on covering up for the rotten food with this lie, the only mistake we did is we didnt record this somewhere offcially in istanbul before we left the city. But definitly I would never recommend this facility or even the whole chain, because the unethical way they handled the service failure is completely unacceptable for me.

Reviews.Title: “very good location and service at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: pugetto
Reviews.Content: I have been living a few years in Istanbul and I consider this hotel one of the best trade off between service, price, location and convenience. A few blocks from Nisantasi, you can enjoy a lot of silence and still have breakfast with a very nice view. Location os probably what I like most as you are very close to Taksim and to the Bosphorus. Of course there are lots of luxurious hotels in Istanbul with gourgeous views, bu they come to an expensive price more often than not. It is recommended for the discrete traveller who enjoys secrecy and a relaxed atmosphere, away from the glittering lights and noise of the city

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull view but ageing hotel...”
Reviews.Author: MonsterGuru
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights, and the view of the restaurant on the 7th floor just made me not rating it as "terrible". Rooms are a bit disgusting, it smells awfully bad, furnitures are old, beds are small... The staff is not too bad but not very helpful at the front desk to explain directions to visit the surroundings. The executive lounge is small but food and drinks are ok... no particular atmosphere. Lobby and gym are as the rooms: small and old but the positive point of the hotel is the huge terrace of the restaurant and the outstanding view. Its really worth having a drink or a meal as the food was good. The swiss hotel next to this Hilton and the other Hilton which is quite close as well are to me more valuable options, even if the price might be a bit more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton ParkSA”
Reviews.Author: Essie45
Reviews.Content: Lovely roof bar/terrace, rooms clean & cosy. I enjoyed my stay there. Terrace the best bit. Especially at sunset with a drink overlooking the Bosphorus. Gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hilton Istanbul instead”
Reviews.Author: FoodandTravel12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in a Bosphorus View room, the views were lovely although the room was quite small, old and showing signs of plenty of wear and tear. We had arranged a an expensive airport pick-up through the hotel as we did not want to have to take the bus or a taxi and navigate our way through the city after a tiring, long-haul flight. Unfortunately we waited 25-30mins in the arrivals area looking for the hotel staff member who was nowhere to be seen, eventually we gave up and had to arrange our own transport to the hotel after all. Once we got into our room, there was the usual welcome note from the Hilton hotel but this time it wasn't addressed to us, but another guest. The room had obviously been prepared for another single guest, the one which the welcome note had been addressed to, and visible through the single pair of slippers and single bathrobe in the bathroom. On the second night during our stay, the power flicked off a couple of times for a few minutes and the next morning our toilet broke and wouldn't stop leaking water. Poor sound insulation has woken us up early each morning at 5am as we could hear the hair dryer going from the room across from us and heavy footsteps from the room above us. Service was average, the reception staff were friendly enough but not particularly helpful. We were wanting to go on a Bosphorus Cruise and enquired regarding where to catch the ferry. The staff member kept pushing for us to use a tour service which they were affiliated with, but otherwise did not provide much in the way of information (we had used this tour service through the hotel the previous day for a full day tour and did not find it particularly good). The best thing about the hotel was the breakfast buffet and the views from the restaurant. You would be better off staying in the newer and larger Hilton Istanbul for a similar price and better amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton ParkSA Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Assade
Reviews.Content: The information on the Hotel's website is misleading. It is actually a very long walk from the Hotel to Taksim Square. Down a very steep hill and back up the other side. If you are getting on in years it would make for very difficult walking. In addition opposite the Hotel is a Discotheque which is open every night until 12midnight and 1am on Sunday mornings. The noise from the Disco is horrendous and makes it impossible to sleep if you happen to have a room on the front of the Hotel. The Hotel allocated me a single room when in fact I had booked and paid for a double room. Their excuse being that as I was single person I just needed a single room! I would not recommend this Hotel if you were thinking of visiting Taksim Square and if you do stay at the Hotel insist on a room on the Garden Side of the Hotel so as to avoid the loud music from the Disco. Also ensure that it you have booked a double room make sure they do not give you a single room.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it so much”
Reviews.Author: marwa_nawwar
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for three nights, rooms were clean, well equipped but little small. receptionists were so helpful and decent. its far some how from taksim or city center may be 5 mintues by taxi, no metro station in its area (matchka) but it quite area for relaxation. breakfast buffet was very delicious and items were various but the only issue that its the same everyday. its good for 4 star hilton standard and we liked it so much.

Reviews.Title: “How to check our Reservation and book a room with sea view”
Reviews.Author: Mojan-87
Reviews.Content: I booked my room with Through Emirates Airline and they did the booking through Mercan Tourism. I received a booking confirmation and when I called Hilton Parksa and gave them the booking number, they told me it is not showing your booking. I would like to book my room with a good view and in a higher floor (to avoid noise). Any idea?

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: principessa_m
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night while on business in Istanbul and I was quite disappointed. I booked last minute and did not really read anything about the hotel. Not that I was expecting a lot from a Hilton... romss were clean but really small, beds and pillows uncomfortable. staff friendly and polite. I decied to get breakfast elsewhere because I wanted some cosy and elegant surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wildcatgirly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days with kids.The hotel was clean and service was good.The staff was friendly.Stay here if you want to be away from the touristic area.There is also a mall in the nisantasi area which is walkable from the hotel.you have a burger king over there in case if you want some fast food.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: starjohnday
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located quite a way from the central sites, when I say this it is at least 20 mins away from Taksim, it is not a pleasant walk. That said there was a restaurant that we could see as we drove out of the hotel which unfortunately I did not take the name of. I had executive lounge access which was pretty good but I would not recommend it for breakfast. I will say that the service in the lounge area was exceptional though. The breakfast on the newly renovated top floor area was great, it had everything that you could ask for and great views to boot. The room was to a good standard and you do get 2 bottles of water free. The only reason I did not rate this hotel higher was due to the location and the fact that I did find alien hair (yuk) in the shower area. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall an OK HIlton **** if not for very poor restaurant recommendation outside of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: Business_or_leisure
Reviews.Content: I was to give 4 or 5, but they annoyed me to the maximum today. I came to the hotel tired. Had dinner in the VERY good restaurant at the top floor, and wanted to go out and do something else, provided its quick, and gives me a discount to the hotel prices. Otherwise I would stay here. There seems to be a few places around the hotel, I asked if you can eat there. They insisted that they are worthless and you have to go to 1 place 5 min away by taxi. That the food is fabulous and the prices are great. 1 floor for fish lovers, 1 for meat lovers. But if we are 2 people and 1 likes fish 1 meat - no problem they will arrange that. I tried to probe on the places around but the lady at the receiption was so beautiful that I gave up. Asked for a taxi. Taxi took 20 minutes. Taxi cheated - but this is standard here in Turkey. She should know they will cheat if they have 5 minutes drive ordered. Restaurant, Nadana, very average and VERY expensive. More expensive than Hilton. Mini Bar earns index 200 usually vs. street bar price. Well it offered 25% discount vs. Nadana. Never seen this in Istanbul. Btw, I think they have different price lists for different guests. Right at the door they asked which hotel recommended us to them. So they gave us "Hilton guests" price list. All prices hand written. I will also refer to executive club. Very poor compared to e.g. Conrad nearby. Ground floow - no view. No beer outside of designated 6 to 8:30 pm hours. Was there at 9 - no beer any more. Just water and soft drinks. Conrad is full service Club at the top floor. Very different. Rooms small - executive are very nice, but not really executive. Stay there only if cheaper than Conrad. And in Istanbul set the short distance price upfront. You will overpay, but at least not go 30 min vs. 10 min it takes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, buy the upgrades”
Reviews.Author: FZG
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is a very long way from the airport and shuttle services located inside the airport will gouge you. Take a standard yellow colored tax that are lined up outside the front door. They are safe and will cost half the price. The rooms are small but comfortable. You will be offered several types of different upgrades for not much money, and they are worth it, such as access to the executive lounge and free drinks, and a breakfast and dinner included. All worth it. The view of the Bosphorus is very good and there are parks galore. The staff is very courteous and knowledgable. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: christiandaly
Reviews.Content: The service was great, one of the best executive lounges in the Hilton chain, great location, and rooms were nice. One of my best Hilton stays. I would recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Wagnar
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 1st of May with my family. Staff was extremely kind and they definetely know what they are doing. All my requests were done in a matter of seconds. Breakfast is served in a neat and clean restaurant on the uppest floor with a view of Bosphorus. Waiters and Waitresses are quite well trained. This hotel will be the choice for my next travel absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “unforgettable memory”
Reviews.Author: mabofan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on busniess trip. I found hotel location is facinating, and service excellent from front office people upto house keeping staff. This made my trip successful and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: schnitzelbunk
Reviews.Content: As long time Hilton Honors members, and also Hilton Grand Vacations owners, we pretty much only stay at the Hilton family of hotels on trips, both business and pleasure. In fact, we used points to stay here. I cannot say enough about this hotel! From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty. The staff was always eager to assist us, from calling taxis and arranging the rate we would be charged by the driver, to exchanging money, to offering suggestions for daily excusions and dining options, etc. They went above and beyond, even sending up a complimentary bottle of wine and tray of fruit when we had not had a good day with a taxi driver and restaurant that had ripped us off. The restaurant has a wonderful buffet breakfast every morning, with a panoramic view of the Bosphorus. The room was always beautifully clean upon our return from breakfast. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views from the restaurant, good four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ancapol
Reviews.Content: Great views in the morning from the cloud 9 restaurant. You have the same view, almost as the Swisotel. The food was good, breakfast large selection. The staff were lovely to me and my young son who would run everywhere! Location is not ideal, you have to take taxis into the centre or if you are slightly fit, you can walk down the hill (5 minutes) and catch the tram line. Walking back up takes about 10 minutes and is not ideal. The other issue was with the Business Centre - the keyboard is in turkish and although they do have signs, they are small. I ended up being offered to browse and print in the executive lounge as I had so many issues. Staff were very quick to sort the problems out. Word of warning about the taxis -always make sure that they turn the metre on as they try and con you. We had at least two taxis that told us one road was closed, and so there would be a 15 minutes detor needed and that it would be cheaper to have the metre off!

Reviews.Title: “POOR VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: parisstar
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 day Xmas Holiday family break ,we prepaid at 160 Euro per room per night ,in september(room only).Then received a voucher for weekends at 82 Euro per night,including breakfast .After some "persuasion" Hotel accepted to include breakfast .But refused to change the rate ,as we had "prepaid" in full.We felt this was contrary to Hilton's policy of "best rate guaranteed",and I am claiming a refund from Hilton Honours,as a long standing member . The Hotel is badly situated,and we had to hire at least four taxis per day ,to reach the sites,wasting hours in traffic jams,and costing over 100 euros per day.The restaurant serves ordinary food at high prices.The staff are extremely friendly and helpful .Rooms are small,nothing like a real Hilton . Customers were mainly German on package tours ,and locals on Congress trips.This is fine,but if you want a holiday in Istanbul,do not go here .Find a boutique hotel in the Old town ,less than 80 euros per night .This Hilton was poor value for us .

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Aus-traveller09
Reviews.Content: We recently spent one night at this hotel, would have loved to be there longer. Our pre-paid transfer dropped us at the wrong hotel, although our paperwork clearly stated Hilton ParkSA, eventually we made our way this hotel. The staff were so friendly, upgraded our room, our room was made available earlier than usual, plus they gave us use of the corporate lounge and coffee while we waited. The roof top restaurant also has good service. I could highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, great views”
Reviews.Author: deprosecutor
Reviews.Content: My now wife and I held our wedding on the terrace at the top of the ParkSA. Because of certain extenuating circumstances, we had to plan the event at the last minute. The hotel staff (from the manager on down) was beyond helpful. They bent over backwards to ensure that our wedding was spectacular. They even managed to accommodate more guests than originally planned, despite the fact that the hotel was overbooked. The breakfast on the top floor was great - especially for an American who wants a taste of home. The hotel is conveniently located near very high end shopping and restaurants and directly above DolmabahÃ§e Palace. It is also much quieter than hotels on Taksim Square. I cannot recommend the hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shuttie
Reviews.Content: Standard quality Hilton.... great staff, perfect service, nice food.. all in all a nice hotel ! Nice views of the Bosphorus. If you are a football fan, then you can look into the BeÅŸiktaÅŸ stadium, which is just below the hotel. You can hear the roar when the home team scores ! Amazing !

Reviews.Title: “Surely not a "Hilton"”
Reviews.Author: DarshanM
Reviews.Content: I was in Istanbul with my wife for the U2 Concert in the first week of September. Having had a good experience with Hilton in India and UK decided on going ahead with the Hilton at Istanbul. To my horror it was nothing like any Hilton..was like a very ordinary budget B&B. Hilton must seriously consider rebranding such properties to avoid misleading consumers. To make matters worse at 200 euros a night it was budget accomodation pricing. And the price vs value just didnt exist..the bed, bed sheets, towels nothing felt world class. The lady at the reception and the guard at the doorway were fab- very helpful always cheerful and sweet. The break fast was the same stuff and we stayed 4 nights so was quite tired of the spread by day two. The staff at the breakfast were sweet. the fresh orange juice was really fresh! I think this place is not worth beyond 65 Euros! The location is good and would recommend the swissotel just down road for stay, food, spa etc..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Slightly Tainted by Attempted Breakfast Charge”
Reviews.Author: Doublebagger
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend had a one night stay at the 'Baby Hilton' in Istanbul in mid July. Lovely hotel, tidy, helpful staff, good room, free fruit bowl. You can even use the Big Hilton's swimming pool, the porter will call you a taxi. Costs about 5TL to get to the other Hilton. Breakfast on the top floor which has great views over the Bosphorus. However, the stay was slightly spoilt when we were given a bill sheet at breakfast that said we had to pay 45TL each for the buffet! My reservation under the "Great Getaway" offer stated breakfast included, reception disagreed and tried to tell me that the words "BUFFET BREAKFAST INCLUDED" only meant that it was a feature of the hotel!! I then showed them their online booking system page which stated that breakfast is explicitly included for the offer I booked. Eventually I wasn't charged after arguing it out, but still, a person shouldn't have to put up with that hassle when they're trying to enjoy what would have been a fabulous breakfast..........

Reviews.Title: “Nice small Hiltol”
Reviews.Author: pegasustr
Reviews.Content: There are pretty close two Hilton hotels in Istanbul. The big one is called as Istanbul Hilton and this one is called ParkSA Hilton. The ParkSA Hilton is 4 star unlike the big 5-star Hilton and doesnâ€™t have any garden or swimming pool. It is location is central but in the morning and evening time it is difficult to find a taxi in this area and walking is not really an option (either up-hill Taksim or down-hill to Besiktas) Parking should be either problematic and/or too expensive. Food, rather 5 star standard than 4 star. I like the breakfast and dinner there, the view is not perfect but you still see the Bosporus. Rooms are clean mid-size and silent. Normally it is at least 30% off price to compare to big-Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel with nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: AgileTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Hilton ParkSA is conventionally located in Istanbul near a large park and is close to many tourist attractions. I stayed here one night for business and received excellent customer service. The rooftop restaurant and bar offers an impressive view of the city, river and the Asian side of Istanbul. The food was outstanding and was moderately priced. Like others have noted, the rooms are a bit small and somewhat outdated. I was in room 118 that has a view of a fence (see the pictures). The benefit to this room is that it is *extremely* quiet and is in a low traffic area of the hotel. All in all, this is a good hotel and I will stay here again if the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Worst 24 Hours of my life”
Reviews.Author: canadian_traveller06
Reviews.Content: Charged for an extra night for early check in Baby kept crying in next room - terrible wall sound insulation, kids in executive floor Renovation Drilling and wall banging

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly hotel for business with good prices”
Reviews.Author: Special_guest_IT
Reviews.Content: I lived in the Parksa for 4 months - from monday to friday - for work reasons. I spent a couple of months also in Hilton Istanbul, Conrad and Movenpick hotels in Istanbul. From a business point of view i think this hotel is the best bargain you can get in the city. The price is good, and as far as I know the hard part is to find a place in the hotel during busy business weeks - but I did not manage this part. The rooms are clean (not very large) and if you are a Hilton diamond client - as I am - the service is good with some amenities. Breakfast offers good choice of food, and dinner is good and fairly priced. View from the terrace restaurant at 7th floor is great. People working in it learn fast about your tastes and preferences and are always gentle and ready to spent a minute with you. I personally prefer this hotel on the others i mentioned because it is smaller, makes you feel confortable and has a "familiar taste". And, when you are thousands miles away from home, it is good to see some familiar faces when you return back from a hard day of work.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & value + great service”
Reviews.Author: cccc9999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Park SA during our last visit to Istanbul and really love how close this hotel is to the NiÅŸantaÅŸÄ± area. Just a short walk up the main road and you're there. The room was not huge, but comfortable enough for two adults and a child. It doesn't really matter as you won't be spending much time in the room in an exciting city like Istanbul. The relaxing scent of toiletries by Crabtree & Evelyn is what you'll find in the bathroom, which is a good choice in my opinion. Towels are white and clean, so are sheets and pillow cases. As with most international chains, you'll find English channels on TV like BBC & CNN. Staff are friendly and helpful and language is not a problem at all. The executive lounge is excellent and the staff in this lounge are extremely friendly and helpful. Two new PCs with internet access are available in the lounge, complete with a colour laser printer. We spent a couple of evenings relaxing there before going out, and always enjoyed the company of the staff there. Taxis? No problem at all. We took taxis everywhere we went and had no problem getting back to the hotel directly. A trip to the grand bazaar costs TL15 in heavy traffic, which is reasonable. Taxi drivers know the hotel well, so it's not a problem at all. Across the main street are a few restaurants and a huge park. There are also many fantastic restaurants at the NiÅŸantaÅŸÄ± area, banks (HSBC, Citibank & etc). For the location, I highly recommend the Hilton Park SA.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: FlyDC
Reviews.Content: So this was our first trip to Istanbul. Decided to stay at the smaller Hilton Park SA instead of the larger Hilton ... a big mistake. The rooms are small and in need of renovation. About 30 minutes after checking in they told us they needed to swap our room. Other room they offered us was smaller. We refused. They eventually found another room of similar size to the original one we had. The bathroom is in most need of updates. Tile and tub are worn and used with stains. Front desk was helpful - but never went out of their way to help. Restaurant (Cloud something or another) was pretty good - but not great. Service was very, very slow. Hotel location is not prime for anyone here to see the sights. (We were ripped off by EVERY cab driver except the one to the hotel from the airport and the one from the hotel to the airport....) Different routes taken by different cabbies everyday had range from Turkish Lira 15 up to 45 ... for the same origin and destination - similar time of day! Was not overly impressed with Istanbul itself. The history was quite amazing, but didn't find the people to be helpful or friendly. Cross this city off my list for good - including Hilton Park SA.

Reviews.Title: “Gentle Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: binxale
Reviews.Content: I stayed many nites to Hilton Parksa...people are very gentle and nice... situated not so near the center but in a really nice and rich aerea ...nisantasci , full or good restaurant and shops... the view from the reastaurant and terrace is very nice...and for the summer it's a good place where to have a bit of fresh air. Gym is very tiny and also the room, but there is not the confusion to be in a big hotel and for business travel is great... anyway in your stay you can use the Hilton Istanbul gym and indoor and outdoor swimming pool as guest of Parksa Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “great service and amazing roof-top views”
Reviews.Author: Mariarti_ru_uk
Reviews.Content: Nice central location in the city. We got upgraded to Bosphorus view, perhaps due to being Hilton Honours programme member. Loved the breakfast in the restaurant on the top floor. Taxi outside is always available to take you to sightseeing places.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay with nice amenities and good location”
Reviews.Author: cnk4
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband to Istanbul, Turkey. He had a conference at a university not far from the hotel. The location was a primary reason for choosing this hotel. After staying there, there were a number of other nice amenities that made it worth the stay. The hotel has been recently updated, so it has a modern and clean feel. Being a Hilton Honors Gold member, my husband had access to the executive floor lounge that was just opened one month prior to our arrival. The lounge had complimentary breakfast with scrambled eggs, veal sausage, yogurt, fresh fruit, cheese, smoked salmon, nuts, fresh juices, coffee/espresso, cereals, etc. from 7 am - 10 am each day. In the afternoon, they offered snacks and drinks from 3 pm - 8:30 pm. It was a very nice option. The hotel had 3-4 public computers with free internet access, which was very convenient. The staff was friendly and accomodating. The hotel also has a lovley rooftop bar and restaurant and seating area for lounging with a gorgeous view of the Bosphorous River. So nice! Although the prices at the restaurant are a bit pricey. The hotel is on a hill, so it isn't easy to walk to a lot of places. But, taxis aren't too expensive. The room was modern and comfortable. We were upgraded to a room with a river view, which was very nice. The airconditioning was a bit breezy, but it worked, so no real complaint there. The bathroom was good with a comfortable shower/tub, toilet, sink, hairdryer, crabtree and evelyn shampoo/soap/conditioner/lotion, etc. They provided robes and slippers along with nice towels. The hotel doesn't have a pool, but the Hilton Istanbul does. They allow guests of the ParkSA to use their facilities free of charge, and it is about a $3 taxi ride each way. I also took advantage of the spa services at the Hilton Istanbul. They were very nice and professional. I would highly recommend the traditional Turkish hammam service also called the 'scrub service.' It was a real treat...and a very nice way to experience a turkish bath experience...hotel style. Overall, a very good experience. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: princess239
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for a family holiday to istanbul. it was overall very good. we landed at sabiha airport on the outskirts of istanbul, but it only took aboout half an hour to get to the hotel. the staff were welcoming and went out of thir way to assist us at all times. rooms were good, spacious, and we got daily complimentary water and fruit. we had breakfast and snacks in the executive lounge which was very good. one evening we ate on the rooftop restaurant and the food was excellent, and reasonably priced. as mentioned staff were really good, and took extra care of my elderly parents. this is a more intimate and i imagine, peaceful hotel than the big hilton just nearby-i would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good but not the best”
Reviews.Author: monana66
Reviews.Content: i stayed there for one week . the rooms were small but good . breakfast room , food and view was great and the best in the hotel. they have free internet service in the business center 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in reasonable location”
Reviews.Author: CummingDubai
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in reasonable location. Beautiful views over Bospherous fro Dining Room. Very friendly polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with great views...”
Reviews.Author: copleycop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Park SA 1/03/2009 had a great time, Only paid Â£62.00 per room including breakfast on the Hilton 50% web offer in January 09, we booked a standard basic room with no view, to our delight when we checked we got up graded to a junior suite with a sea/river view all for Â£62.00 per room amazing value. The only negatives I had where, even though it was a junior suite the beds are rock hard, I'm 31 years old fit & healthy and 7 days later I am still suffering with back ache from the hard beds...ouch!. Also as a non smoker and living in the U.K, we are not allowed to smoke in any indoor public places so I struggled with the smoking issues all over Istanbul & in the hotel. Also if you are staying on a weekend, take ear plugs as they are several nightclubs and cafe bars in the park across from the hotel that stay open until the early hours and the noise is really loud, shouting, taxi's beeping there horns etc. The staff where great and the breakfast was fantastic eggs to order every morning. I had a really great time at the hotel but wouldn't of wanted to pay any more than I did.......

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service at the Hilton Park”
Reviews.Author: HiIslandsGuy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for two days, intending to move to another hotel, but ended up staying a week. This decision was based solely on the exceptional service I received at the Hilton Park. I arrived at 8:30 am after three long, grueling flights from Asia. I wondered what kind of reception I would receive. The front desk staff worked hard to find a room for me, and even fed me coffee and cookies while they worked. I was upstairs and in the shower within ten minutes and in bed sound asleep within twenty. The service attitude at this hotel must be contagious; the staff in the restaurant, the housekeeping department, the laundry, the bellmen, all--without exception-- seemed to go out of their way to be helpful. I decided it would be hard for another hotel to measure up to this level of service so I decided just to stay put at the Hilton Park. The hotel is located on a hill above a city park, overlooking the Bosphorus. If you stay on floors five and above, you can get a wonderful view. You can walk down the hill to the tramway and the subway station in about 15 minutes. It takes about 20 minutes to walk up the hill. If you walk up the street from the hotel, you find yourself in a nice neighborhood with several very good restaurants. The restaurants in the hotel are good, but the menus are limited. The breakfast buffet is extensive and well prepared. They will also make eggs to order and a la carte breakfasts. The rooms are of typical size with comfortable beds, a decent desk and desk chair, and a spacious bath. Toiletries are Crabtree and Evelyn. The towels are plush and plentiful. Housekeeping was in my room cleaning within minutes of my departure each day, so I always came back to a clean fresh room. The hotel's Internet service is fast, efficient and expensive. The only negative for this hotel relates to the a/c. They had turned it off for the season (it was December, after all) but I found the room got very warm at night and I needed to open the windows. This allowed a significant amount of street noise to enter the room. If you are staying in the winter time and need to have cool, fresh air at night, you may wish to consider foregoing the Bosphorus view and stay on the other side of the hall in exchange for a more peaceful night's sleep-- or bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: hecman111
Reviews.Content: The Hilton ParkSA Istanbul is a nice hotel with a kind and helpful staff. I stayed there for five nights and for the most part enjoyed staying there. Unfortunately, the walls are thin and I was placed on a smoking floor so the fumes got pretty bad. When I reported the problem to the staff, they offered to spray some freshener the next day which helped when I came back from sightseeing (even though it got bad again later that night). The rooms are nicely sized, but the beds are a little hard. Although I only had a view of a wall (being on the second floor and all), I liked that the windows could be opened up to get some fresh air. The bathrooms were very clean and well stocked. Water pressure was good although I might have liked it if the water got a little hotter. The room had several channels, but only about 4 of them were in English. Hi-speed Internet is available in your room, but for a pretty high price. The business center came in handy because I was able to communicate with family back home since U.S. phone cards and cell phones don't work in Turkey. The outlets are standard European outlets, so be sure to bring a converter if you're coming from the states. The front desk clerks, bell hops, and doormen were all very friendly and were happy to call us a cab or answer any questions. The hotel is pretty conveniently located with just a 15-20 minute walk (downhill going, but uphill coming back) to the tram/ferry station or a 5YTL cab ride. Breakfast is a little pricey (35YTL) so we mostly ate out. The view from the rooftop restaurant and terrace is amazing and I would think that some of the rooms on the higher floors facing the Bosphorus have great views, too. Overall, a nice hotel with a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Young Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimSemlik
Reviews.Content: 1.Very close to Nisantasi which is the 5th Avenue of Istanbul. The street is called "AbdiIpekci Caddesi" 2. Beautiful Bospborus View (If you have an Amex card, get your self upgraded, insist!!!) 3. Very modern and you feel safe in the hotel :) 4. The hotel has a marvelous restaurant on the roof. 5. Make sure you get Breakfast included cause you would be suprise to see varieties and richness of the Turkish breakfast :) It was amazing: 6.One thing; " Putting the sign card of " DO NOT DISTURB......they will still get in to your room to fill your fridge " just to put soda in your fridge so make sure you call and tell the manager- NO ONE TO enter your room" 7. I booked this hotel at HILTON.COM they had specials and it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant weekend break in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BA-traveler
Reviews.Content: Getting of Ataturk airport was stressful; it took us almost two hours, due to very long lines for visa and immigration. Outside we took the HavaÅŸ connection, a luxury bus with enough space for luggage. There are only a very few stops to the city and the fare is 9 TRY (new Turkish Lira) p.p. or â‚¬ 5.50/$ 8.00. From the end stop at Taksim Square it is only a short taxi ride to the Hilton Park Hotel. The hotel is situated on a hill. From outside it doesnâ€™t look very special, inside it has a modern lobby and there are 7 floors, on the top floor is the restaurant. Front desk staff was very friendly and we were given a nice room on the 5th floor with view on the Bosphorus. The room is not very spacious, but it had a comfortable chair with small table, a working desk with chair, a small LCD flat screen TV and a large closet, all very modern furniture. The bathroom was marble and had a bath with shower. Nice detail, there was a fresh flower next to the sink. It is mentioned in former reviews that the bed is terrible and we can only agree. It is hard, not comfortable at all and the thin mattress was too big for the frame underneath. So on one side it felt that you are rolling out of the bed. In the room are also a minibar and a water cooker with cups and Nescafe and tea bags. For our welcome as Diamond members we were given a plate with fresh fruit and a bottle of red wine. Everything was already in our room when we arrived. In the evening we had dinner in the restaurant. There is plenty of staff, but the food is very pricey. For instance, my husband had a small steak for 32 TRY (â‚¬ 19/$ 28) and this is served on a further empty plate!!! We had to buy everything as potatoes and vegetables extra, and then you get extremely tiny portions of each. At the end we took coffee and we are used that in restaurants this is served with sweets. Nothing at all, and a coffee or cappuccino costs 8 or 9 TRY a cup, be aware that is for the latter â‚¬ 5.50 of $ 8.00 each. We have been all over the world, but have never paid that much for just coffee. There is a business center with two computers and printers. You have to pay for every half hour you use it, but when I checked my mail for just 10 minutes or so, they didnâ€™t charge me, what was very friendly. Breakfast was included in our rate and was very good. Many things to choose from and eggs could be ordered in every way. Again, there was much staff in the restaurant. The view from the top floor was fantastic in the early morning hours. On our second day we took a taxi to the city center, not very expensive (rather odd, we paid the same amount as for a cup of coffee in the hotel!) After our return we found a plate with delicious bonbons in our room. From the hotel it is a 10-15 minute walk to a very busy area with shops and restaurants (out of the hotel go the right and keep walking in that direction, after a while the road will split and you have to make a slight curve to the right). Istanbul is a nice city, but far to busy with tourists when we were there (last weekend in 2007). After all we had a pleasant stay in the hotel. The staff is very forthcoming, the room is okay besides the bed and the breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Great View”
Reviews.Author: randallbellaire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 days in August 2007. A very modern hotel with all the amenities you would expect at a classy hotel anywhere. Very pricey bar, restaurant, and room service. Well appointed rooms with very nice baths. No problems with AC/water etc. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Upgraded to business class level with my Honors points and received a corner room with a fantastic view of the Bosphorus! I stayed in a couple of other hotels on this trip and the Hilton and Radisson were both excellent. Highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure travel.

Reviews.Title: “agreed.. hard beds, nice roof top views”
Reviews.Author: barbuhomme
Reviews.Content: I agree, the beds are very hard. The roof top is great. they serve a Breakfast buffet each morning. A bit high priced, but try it a least once. it is very nice. The staff was very friendly.
